Class Animal

Animal
All Implemented Interfaces:

    • die

      protected void die(World world)
      Parameters:
      world - Removes this Animal from world

    • path

      protected List<Location> path(World world, Location start, Location target)
      Parameters:
      world - World to path find in
      start - The start of the path
      target - Where to path find to
      Returns:
      A path from start to target when successful. Null if start equals target.

    • path

      protected List<Location> path(World world, Location start, Object object)
      Finds a path from Location start to an Object in world using path(World world, Location start, Location target)
      Parameters:
      world - World where the Animal(this) and the target(object) are placed.
      start - Location to start from
      object - Object to path find to
      Returns:
      returns a path from start to object found by path(World world, Location start, Location target)

    • closest_object

      protected Object closest_object(Class c, Location from, World world, int view_distance, boolean include_mid)
      Parameters:
      c - The type of object that is being searched for
      from - Where to search from
      world - World to search in
      view_distance - How far away the object may be
      include_mid - Whether to include from when searching
      Returns:
      returns the closest object of type c from location within view_distance

    • wander

      protected void wander(World world, Location from)
      Makes use of random_move to move the Animal in a random direction.
      Parameters:
      world - World to wander in
      from - Location to wander from

    • random_move

      protected Location random_move(World world, Location start)
      Parameters:
      world - The world to wander in
      start - The location to wander from
      Returns:
      A random location exactly 1 tile from start

    • seek

      protected void seek(Class c, World world, Location start, int view_distance)
      Makes use of closest_object to find an object of type c, then uses the path-method to find a path from start to that object. It then moves to the first Location in the List path returned.
      Parameters:
      c - Type to seek
      world - World to seek in
      start - Where to seek from
      view_distance - How far away the target can be
